intro: Synstylis micranthera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved synstylis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
